View this post on the web at https://www.meidasplus.com/p/important-message-from-ben-meiselas-b8c

By Ben Meiselas
Hey MeidasMighty. It’s Ben Meiselas, co-founder of MeidasTouch Network.
Yesterday was a big win for the pro-democracy community and a major loss for Trump, Musk, and DOGE. Here’s what happened. 
The pro-democracy candidate for the vacant Wisconsin Supreme Court seat, Judge Susan Crawford, defeated the MAGA/DOGE candidate Brad Schimel. Judge Crawford won 55.1% to 44.9%, and she flipped at least nine counties that voted for Trump in November.
The Wisconsin Supreme Court will now be controlled by a pro-democracy majority.
The illegal gerrymandering tricks by the MAGA Republicans in Wisconsin will now likely be over.
This will likely lead to Democrats picking up more House of Representatives seats in 2026 in Wisconsin and help Democrats flip the House blue and reclaim the majority. In addition, essential rights and freedoms in Wisconsin will now be protected, like reproductive rights.
The election results in Wisconsin were a validation of the growing and gathering strength of the pro-democracy movement in the United States. It was also a major repudiation of Musk and Trump and DOGE.
Elon Musk put $20 million into the race, made a personal visit to hold a rally in Green Bay this past weekend, and was literally handing out money to people to vote for Schimel. Musk handed out $1 million checks to some people who participated in his pay-for-play vote stunt.
In addition to Musk, Trump repeatedly directed people to vote for Schimel in social media posts and from the Oval Office. Trump had the entire force of the federal government and the White House to try and help Schimel win. He failed big time.
Further, all of the right-wing “podcast bros” descended on Wisconsin and waged their usual information war to defame and destroy Judge Crawford and help Brad Schimel. The right-wing media ecosystem threw everything they had to try and help Schimel win with a nonstop torrent of lies and propaganda. They failed.
Let me be clear. The real heroes who helped Judge Crawford win this critical election were all the volunteers, phone bankers, and canvassers who helped get out the vote.
In addition, Wisconsin’s Democratic Chair Ben Wikler is a savant at organizing and getting out the vote. The entire Democratic Party mobilized an incredible operation.
In my opinion, Judge Crawford was also a great candidate with the perfect judicial temperament.
At the MeidasTouch Network, we made covering this race a top priority. As I am sure you’ve seen, we’ve relentlessly covered this race whereas corporate news was too busy focusing on whatever distraction or shiny object Trump threw at them.
At the MeidasTouch Network, we recognized early on that as the leader of all news media, with the most digital views and podcast downloads of any news network or show today, we had to meet the moment in a big way.
Our focus was simple. It was imperative we push back against the lies of the right-wing media ecosystem in Wisconsin and go on the offense with the truth.
We covered this Wisconsin election not just in the days leading up to the election. As you know, we’ve been covering this election for months.
We have had Judge Crawford [ https://substack.com/redirect/a80a5df9-d931-4fbb-9d76-c45532f5bd4a?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ] as a guest multiple times.
We had Wisconsin Chair Ben Wikler on when he broke the news [ https://substack.com/redirect/f85b0427-9766-428c-b1c6-fa9d680f0418?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ] calling out Musk’s paying-for-vote scheme.
Our editorial team broke dozens of stories [ https://substack.com/redirect/f1a613e5-0578-4d27-81ac-130d7c350631?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ] about Brad Schimel’s despicable behavior, positions, and statements from the past.
We at the MeidasTouch Network saw this race as a case study in how the MeidasTouch Network can use its leading position to cut through all the lies and spin and just tell the truth.
We believed the MeidasTouch Network reporting on the objective facts was the perfect antidote against the Musk and Trump propaganda machine in Wisconsin.
I can’t quantify how big of a role our coverage played. I again want to emphasize the real heroes here are not us, but all the volunteers and the voters in Wisconsin and all those on the ground. But it has warmed my heart to hear all the feedback we have been getting at the MeidasTouch Network that our network effectively shut down the right-wing disinformation machine in Wisconsin.
Even if we played just a small role in fighting back to stop the right-wing media from overwhelming Wisconsin with lies, I am honored and humbled to have played that tiny role.
The results in Wisconsin should give us all hope about the growing strength of the pro-democracy movement. Although the Democratic candidates did not win their elections in the Special Elections in Florida’s 1st and 6th Congressional Districts, the Democrats closed the gap by almost 20 points from where the vote was back in November 2024. If these results hold, there will be a blue tsunami the likes of which has never been seen in about 19 months (579 days to be specific). The 2026 midterms are closer than you think.
I know there is a lot of doom and gloom news with Trump. But it’s important that you remember that Trump thought he’d destroy all resistance and opposition by this point. Not only has he failed, but the opposition and resistance have grown stronger. The MeidasTouch Network has grown stronger to the position of the most viewed news network in the United States and abroad.
At the MeidasTouch Network, we are honored and humbled by the role we play here and the trust you have put in us. We fight every day and do all we can to meet the moment.
The fact that we get more views and downloads than Fox and Joe Rogan means our message is getting out. (Remember to add the MeidasTouch Podcast on Apple Podcasts [ https://substack.com/redirect/8ca8aad8-5c36-4709-ab0f-395203205457?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ] and Spotify [ https://substack.com/redirect/89b5080a-3237-4655-a5c1-93078826cc71?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ] to keep this momentum going.)
Let’s take the momentum from Wisconsin and build.
Now is the time we need your help more than ever. We must keep building the infrastructure of this media network to prepare for what is ahead. I hope you’ve seen the success from the growth of the MeidasTouch Network and why it’s so important we keep growing. Your help is needed.
Please subscribe to this Substack now if you can to support our independent reporting and independent media network.
We don’t have the resources of Fox or Rogan or anywhere near it, but with your support we’ve stayed at the top.
Thanks for subscribing and helping us continue to grow, and fight, and win the information battle with the truth.
Meidas+ is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support our work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.

Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubWVpZGFzcGx1cy5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.KZbEU8SeIcMsItqbcrq9-XWjjmvS-bRZym-fyr3-gNw?

input.content:
**Hi Founders, Investors, and Friends! ** 

Welcome back, here’s what’s happening:

* ✍️ OpenAI’s new guide on [how to prompt](https://academy.openai.com/public/videos/mastering-prompts-the-key-to-getting-what-you-need-from-chatgptmastering-prompts-the-key-to-getting-what-you-need-from-chatgpt-2025-03-20)

* 📱 **Mark Cuban** is backing an [alternative to TikTok](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/01/mark-cuban-backs-skylight-a-tiktok-alternative-built-on-blueskys-underlying-technology/)

* ⚖️ Watch YC President, **Garry Tan**, testify on Capitol Hill — [making the case for ‘Little Tech’](https://x.com/Overlap_Tech/status/1907205943089402230)



_Now, let’s dive in to the stories shaping our industry._

———————————————————————————

# _**DRIVING THE DAY**_

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/0cd313f8-7724-4579-8843-54b2c6d6acfa/cover.png?t=1743592484)
Caption: 



➔ **Meta’s $1,000+ Smart Glasses Are Coming for Your iPhone**
Meta is gearing up to launch its first screen-equipped smart glasses, codenamed [Hypernova](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-01/how-meta-s-upcoming-1000-smart-glasses-with-a-screen-will-work?utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&cmpid%3D=socialflow-twitter-tech&utm_content=tech&utm_source=twitter), by year’s end—with gesture controls, a heads-up display, and a $1,300 price tag. The glasses will showcase circular app icons, support phone notifications, and come bundled with a neural wristband for hand-gesture input, aiming to bridge today’s Ray-Bans and tomorrow’s true AR wearables. It’s all part of Meta’s broader push to own the next major computing platform after the smartphone



➔ **ChatGPT Hits 20M Subscribers, Raking in $415M a Month**
OpenAI’s chatbot now boasts 20 million paying users and is on a $5 billion annual revenue run rate—[up 30% in just three months](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/chatgpt-revenue-surges-30-just-three-months?rc=ghbbgh). Despite profits still being a distant dream, revenue growth and the rise of high-priced Pro plans are fueling OpenAI’s ambitious $40 billion raise at a $260 billion valuation. If momentum holds, that 2025 revenue projection of $12.7 billion is looking more like a floor than a ceiling 



➔ **Visa Dangles $100M to Snatch Apple Card From Mastercard**
With Goldman Sachs ditching consumer lending, Visa has offered Apple a nine-figure payday to replace Mastercard as the Apple Card’s payment network. American Express is also in the hunt—hoping to be both issuer and network—while Mastercard scrambles to retain one of the biggest co-branded cards in the market. Beyond the fees, this is about owning the rails of [Apple’s growing financial ecosystem](https://www.wsj.com/finance/banking/apple-card-visa-mastercard-deal-3ce762da?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1)

———————————————————————————

### _The SEO Arms Race Moves to AI Search_

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/e096e883-b1f6-4544-a04a-30fb93765a28/seo.png?t=1743590263)
Caption: 

**What’s Happening**
A new digital battlefield is emerging, and it’s not on Google or Amazon—it’s in AI chatbots. Retailers like Coterie and SpyGuy are seeing traffic and sales coming directly from ChatGPT, Perplexity, and other AI-driven search engines. 

These tools, now influencing buyer behavior, are [prompting brands to rethink](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/ai-search-new-arms-race-retailers?rc=ghbbgh) how they appear in AI-generated product recommendations. The challenge? There’s no playbook for ranking in AI search—yet. This shift is already giving rise to a new crop of startups pitching themselves as the “SEO for AI.”

* **AI as a Discovery Engine:** Coterie saw an uptick in customers who found them via ChatGPT, treating it as a new marketing channel. But unlike traditional search, AI platforms don’t reliably offer links or transparency about ranking logic, making optimization murky at best.

* **Enter the AI-SEO Arms Race:** Startups like Profound are trying to reverse-engineer AI search by generating thousands of prompts and tracking which brands show up. Their clients, including Eight Sleep and Ramp, use this data to tailor web content to AI answers—like dedicated landing pages or FAQs that map to common queries.

* **Amazon's AI Assistant Joins the Fray:** Brands selling on Amazon are adjusting their listings for Rufus, the platform’s AI shopping assistant. Instead of splashy visuals, they’re packing product pages with detailed copy—because Rufus “reads the text,” even if human customers don’t.


**Why It Matters**:
AI search is still small, but it’s growing fast—and that could rewrite the rules of e-commerce. With platforms like ChatGPT and Perplexity influencing buyer intent, brands are being pushed to optimize not just for humans, but for bots that behave like humans.

Unlike Google or Amazon, these AI tools don’t yet sell prime real estate in search results, meaning influence must be earned, not bought. That could erode the value of traditional digital ad spend and empower quality-first brands. But if AI search remains opaque and resistant to gaming, it may finally create the meritocratic discovery engine marketers always claimed to have wanted.

———————————————————————————

----------
### _BEST OF THE REST_

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/9ecbb45a-fd16-4ace-9477-538fa1f97121/ai.png?t=1743589751)
Caption: 

➔ **How Do We Share the Planet With This New Superintelligence?**
Historian-philosopher Yuval Harari argues that AI’s real danger isn’t killer robots—it’s the hijacking of human culture through synthetic speech, language, and manipulation at scale. He urges governments to treat AI not like a product but like a nuclear-level threat to democracy and collective meaning [WIRED](https://www.wired.com/story/questions-answered-by-yuval-noah-harari-for-wired-ai-artificial-intelligence-singularity)

➔ **California and New York May Ban AI ‘Companions’ for Kids**
Two landmark bills in California and New York aim to ban AI companions targeted at minors, warning that emotionally manipulative bots could become digital predators in disguise. Backers cite rising concerns over children forming bonds with AI that blur boundaries and rewire social development [Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/04/01/ai-companions-kids-ca-ny-bill-ban)

➔ **Are We Taking AI Seriously Enough?**
The New Yorker examines our oddly casual relationship with AI, likening it to standing in front of an oncoming train while arguing over who gets to wear the conductor’s hat. Beneath the tech hype lies a growing unease that we’ve outsourced too much power to systems we barely understand [New Yorker](https://www.newyorker.com/culture/open-questions/are-we-taking-ai-seriously-enough)


----------———————————————————————————

### _Meta’s Upcoming Smart Glasses Will Include a Screen_

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/886629e4-3f7f-4621-97b5-7ce77dae93a7/zuck.JPG?t=1743591168)
Caption: 

**What’s Happening**
Meta is gearing up to launch its [most advanced smart glasses yet](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-01/how-meta-s-upcoming-1000-smart-glasses-with-a-screen-will-work?srnd=phx-technology) — a premium model with a built-in screen and gesture control, codenamed _Hypernova_. Expected to debut by year’s end, the device will reportedly cost over $1,000 and aims to bridge the gap between today’s wearable tech and full-on augmented reality. 

Unlike the Ray-Ban Meta glasses, these new specs will display notifications and apps through a monocular lens and respond to swipes and wrist gestures. Meta is also working on a second-gen version with a binocular display slated for 2027, as it inches closer to its long-term AR ambitions.

* **Display & Controls Get an Upgrade:** The Hypernova glasses will feature a single display in the right lens’s lower-right quadrant — visible when glancing downward. Users can control the device using touch-sensitive temple bars or a bundled neural wristband that recognizes hand gestures like pinching or rotating.

* **iPhone Alternative in the Making:** With a UI resembling the app dock on Apple devices, the glasses will include native apps for maps, photos, and messaging (WhatsApp, Messenger). They’ll run a modified Android OS and pair with a phone for calls, media, and AI-powered voice commands via Meta View.

* **Next-Gen Plans & Market Strategy:** Meta is already developing a second version with dual displays (Hypernova 2), alongside a more athletic, screenless Oakley-style pair (Supernova 2). Meanwhile, the original Hypernova will feature an upgraded camera, new triangular carrying case, and is expected to be positioned as a stepping stone to Meta’s full AR glasses, Artemis.

**Why It Matters**
This isn’t just another wearable — it’s Meta’s clearest swing yet at creating a post-smartphone future. The Hypernova glasses sit between today’s “dumb” smart glasses and tomorrow’s true AR headsets, aiming to ease consumers into screen-on-your-face tech. 

With Apple Vision Pro targeting high-end mixed reality and Meta doubling down on everyday wearables, the battle for the next computing platform is heating up — and glasses might just be the gateway. Whether consumers are ready to spend $1,400 to find out remains to be seen.

———————————————————————————

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/6f23f859-2a04-469c-a5dd-5e74e43df7b7/VC_Corner_pyramids.png?t=1743020798)
Caption: 

----------
View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/668240b6-0ede-499f-8d68-d3573b9765fe/ceo.jpg?t=1743589499)
Caption: Replit CEO Amjad Masad

➔ **Replit in Talks for $3 Billion Valuation** – The AI-powered developer platform known for popularizing "vibecoding" is in advanced discussions to raise new funding that would push its valuation to $3 billion, up from $1.2 billion just a year ago [Link](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-02/-vibecoding-leader-replit-in-talks-for-3-billion-valuation?srnd=phx-technology)

➔ **Construct Capital Raises $300M Fund** – The Washington, D.C.-based VC firm launched its second fund with a focus on startups in manufacturing, defense, and supply chain infrastructure [Link](https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/31/construct-capital-raises-300m-fund-for-defense-and-manufacturing-tech/)

➔ **Qualcomm Acquires VinAI’s Generative AI Division** – The chip giant has acquired the AI division of Vietnamese startup VinAI to bolster its edge AI capabilities and compete in the on-device generative AI race [Link](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/01/qualcomm-acquires-generative-ai-division-of-vietnamese-startup-vinai/)

➔ **Circle Files to Go Public** – The issuer of the USDC stablecoin has formally filed to go public, aiming to become the first major crypto firm to IPO in 2025 [Link](https://www.theinformation.com/briefings/circle-files-ipo-publicly?rc=ghbbgh)

➔ **Andreessen Horowitz Eyes TikTok Stake** – A16z has reportedly joined Oracle’s investor group vying for a stake in TikTok, aiming to gain influence over the platform amid regulatory pressure [Link](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/01/andreessen-horowitz-is-trying-to-nab-a-piece-of-tiktok-with-oracle-report-says/)

➔ **Revaia Raises $250M Fund** – The Paris-based growth equity firm closed its second fund to back late-stage European startups with a focus on sustainability and tech [Link](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-04-02/european-venture-firm-revaia-raises-250-million-for-new-fund?srnd=phx-technology)


----------———————————————————————————

#### _WHAT WE’RE LISTENING TO_

Youtube: Kevin Scott, CTO @ Microsoft: An Evaluation of Deepseek and How We Underestimate the Chinese (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KN7KYzpPfiU)

———————————————————————————

----------

Whether you’re selling B2B or raising your next round, build your brand with a variety of sponsorship opportunities in our newsletter - [learn more here](https://app.beehiiv.com/direct_sponsorships/9279dae1-87a1-426b-8e70-c13bda0ec4d8).

input.content:
View this post on the web at https://admiredleadership.substack.com/p/developing-team-members-with-a-proactive

Every leader wants a team of proactive colleagues who anticipate needs, issues, and opportunities and step up to address them without being asked.
By anticipating problems, roadblocks, and opportunities and acting on them before they arise, proactive team members make life easier for leaders and for each other.
Proactive team members develop an eye for situations and consider how they might unfold. They constantly scan what is planned or coming up and begin preparing now for what might occur.
As part of their planning process, they think through the best-case and worst-case possibilities of situations and then decide what actions they might take to get ahead of the negatives and take advantage of the positives.
In other words, they solve problems before they happen and pursue opportunities before they materialize.
Being proactive isn’t innate or personality-driven. Everyone has the capacity to think ahead and prepare for problems and opportunities before they occur. However, some team members are much more proactive than others.
Why do some team members take the initiative over situations rather than waiting for things to happen? Unbeknownst to many leaders, it is the leader’s own actions that produce or discourage proactivity.
People anticipate and take the initiative when two things exist: an expectation that they should do so, and recognition for being proactive even when the outcome of their effort is less than desired.
The best leaders emphasize the importance of anticipating and behaving proactively. They make it a point to state that taking the initiative is expected and makes everyone and everything more effective.
Empowering others to act without being asked starts with more than permission. Because many leaders and team environments punish initiative, leaders must highlight how important it is. And that they presume people will act accordingly.
Practicing proactivity in a group setting is the next step. Brainstorming about upcoming events and the possible problems and opportunities they afford is a great way to set the stage for more proactive behavior.
Talking through what actions can be taken now before the event or episode occurs can be a lightbulb for some and illustrate the power of anticipation and action.
But now the real discipline begins.
Team members won’t take the chance to engage proactively if they think it can get them in trouble. Anytime they see initiative, good leaders underline and thank team members for anticipating issues and opportunities and acting on them without being asked.
Good leaders reward the initiative, not the outcome. Sure, it’s essential to highlight how much easier, better, or more effective a given project turned out because of a team member’s proactive choices. But even more important is focusing on a team member’s tremendous initiative despite a lousy outcome.
This tells everyone that proactive behavior is what matters most, not the result.
When leaders expect people to take the initiative and give them the room to do so, they are often rewarded with innovative and energetic actions that help them and the team.
Nothing is more rewarding for a leader than a team full of colleagues who bring a proactive attitude to everything they do. They prepare more than they repair, and that is a boon to leaders.

Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9hZG1pcmVkbGVhZGVyc2hpcC5zdWJzdGFjay5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.bWjyGpwF7VkRbrWnZCrxhvsov-Rou1Vory0ZP3IXqQ4?
input.subject: Developing Team Members With a Proactive Attitude

input.content:
View this post on the web at https://allysammarco.substack.com/p/wisconsin-rejects-maga

Happy Tuesday and welcome back to Today’s American News, your source for news and analysis on the circus that is American politics and entertainment.
ELECTION UPDATE FROM WISCONSIN: Democrat Susan Crawford is projected to win over Elon Musk’s preferred candidate, Brad Schimel, in a nationally watched state Supreme Court race. See election results here [ https://substack.com/redirect/235e4144-f675-4158-84ac-e7c1106b8497?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ].
Trump funding cuts force closure of dozens of free measles vaccine clinics in Texas amid outbreak… NBC News reports [ https://substack.com/redirect/524d572a-a862-4ee6-ae70-e12dbf60c3a0?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ], “Steep federal funding cuts have forced public health officials in one of Texas’ most populous counties — Dallas — to cancel dozens of vaccination clinics and lay off 21 workers on the front lines of combatting the state’s growing measles outbreak. ‘...we’ve had to cancel over 50 different clinics in our community,’ said Dr. Philip Huang, director and health authority for the Dallas County Health and Human Services Department. Many of the clinics had been planned for schools in areas with low vaccination rates, he said. The vaccines, which included measles, mumps and rubella shots, were meant to be given free to families. The money being cut — $11.4 billion nationwide — was originally allocated to aid community health departments during the pandemic. Local public health officials have more recently been using the Covid funds for other public health initiatives, such as measles prevention, surveillance and testing.”
Sen. Cory Booker sets record for longest Senate floor speech at 25 hours to protest Trump administration… Politico reports [ https://substack.com/redirect/bf45b395-2d2b-4534-9933-f30c3e5bc251?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ], “Cory Booker wrote himself into the Senate annals Tuesday, setting a new record for the chamber’s longest speech when he held the floor for more than 25 hours and surpassed the late Sen. Strom Thurmond’s 1957 filibuster against civil rights. The New Jersey Democrat took the floor at 6:59 p.m. on Monday, saying he was doing so with the ‘intention of disrupting the normal business of the United States Senate for as long as I am physically able’ in order to protest the actions of President Donald Trump and his administration.”
Common Sense with Ally Sammarco is a reader-supported publication. To receive new posts and support my work, consider becoming a free or paid subscriber.
GOP holds two heavily Republican districts in Florida special elections… CNN reports [ https://substack.com/redirect/05a9b5d9-9ce4-4f2b-9db2-3eba4b94d4a8?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ], “Republicans will hold onto two seats in their narrow House majority as former Florida state Sen. Randy Fine will win the special election for an open US House seat in Florida’s 6th Congressional District and Republican Jimmy Patronis will win Florida’s 1st Congressional District, according to a projection from the CNN Decision Desk. Fine will replace national security adviser Mike Waltz in the House, and Patronis fills a seat that has been vacant since mid-November, when Trump announced former Rep. Matt Gaetz as his initial choice for attorney general. Both wins will deliver much-needed reinforcements for House Speaker Mike Johnson’s narrow majority in the House of Representatives. Few anticipated a competitive race for Waltz’s seat when he resigned in January. President Donald Trump won the district by 30 points in November.”
11 House Rs stop Johnson effort to kill remote voting for House members who are new parents… NBC News reports [ https://substack.com/redirect/fed7d5c7-37b8-461a-ad76-4a9d186019e8?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ], “A band of Republican lawmakers sank an effort Tuesday by Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., to kill a plan to allow remote voting for lawmakers who become new parents, a bitter dispute that brought the House floor to a halt. A procedural rule vote to advance the House GOP’s package of bills for the week failed 206-222, with nine Republicans bucking Johnson and voting with all 213 Democrats. The failed vote means that, for now, those pieces of legislation cannot move forward for final votes… ‘Rep. Anna Paulina Luna, R-Fla., who has led the proxy-voting push and clashed with Johnson’ said, “‘parents deserve a voice in Washington.’ …Luna, who gave birth to her first child in 2023, had planned to force a floor vote this week on a resolution that would allow new mothers and fathers in the House to be able to vote remotely, through proxies, for up to 12 weeks.”
Today’s Furry Friend
Meet Blue, who lives on a boat and his buddy Fez, the neighbor cat who loves coming on the boat for playdates.
Today’s Buzz
F1 is hyped at CinemaCon as audience is treated to first 10 minutes of Brad Pitt’s Formula One action flick… The Hollywood Reporter writes [ https://substack.com/redirect/2c9ff9c4-4134-4cd3-8d7f-1fc85f004318?j=eyJ1IjoiajdtdW0ifQ.sCMgg6RENl3vRV2I6HBtE7TLCcexj65ihVJMyWM1atU ], “F1 director Joseph Kosinski and producer Jerry Bruckheimer returned to the CinemaCon stage… Warner Bros. is distributing the Apple film that stars Brad Pitt, Damson Idris and Javier Bardem. ‘We believe this is going to be the cinematic experience of the summer,’ Bruckheimer teased. He promised the movie would offer ‘action, romance and humor. It’s truly the ultimate theater experience.’ Additionally, Kosinski praised Pitt for ‘driving himself at 180 miles an hour.’ The pair then revealed the film’s action-packed first 10 minutes. ‘Just let me drive, will you?’ Pitt says in the footage as no-longer-retired driver Sonny Hayes. Later, he warns a fellow driver while stepping out of his vehicle, ‘Lose that lead, I’ll kill you.’ The film hits theaters and IMAX from Warner Bros. on June 25. Kerry Condon and Tobias Menzies round out the cast. F1 features Pitt as Sonny, a former Formula One racer who was forced into early retirement until a team owner (Bardem) asks him to return to the sport and help mentor a rookie driver (Idris).” The movie hits theaters in June.
Check back in tomorrow evening for the next edition of Today’s American News.

Unsubscribe https://substack..-YiMzvhDNeKXLYk1snlUPVgblIzjLvpphFGQz84Ju80?
